issue.title: www.onlinegdb.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [NSFW] [https://gaystream.pw/view/blowing-a-responsive-hot-waiter-lorenzo/60138](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgaystream.pw%2Fview%2Fblowing-a-responsive-hot-waiter-lorenzo%2F60138) ### Comment > ## Description > The website contains a video player named **"Multi HD"** that appears to use a highly sophisticated adblock-detection mechanism. > > When an ad blocker is enabled, the player displays the first overlay: > > *"You are using AdBlocker. The owner of this video doesn't allow AdBlocker. Please disable your AdBlocker, Thank you."* > > If this overlay is manually blocked, the player shows a second overlay: > > *"Video keep loading? Select a different server or refresh the page."* > > From my observation, once adblock usage is detected, the **actual video player** is never loaded at all. Instead, it is replaced entirely with one of these two overlays. This means the real video stream never initiates when adblock is detected. > > --- > > ## Steps to Reproduce > 1. Enable any ad blocker (AdGuard, uBlock Origin, etc.). > 2. Open the website containing the **"Multi HD"** player. > 3. Notice the first overlay appears. > 4. Block the first overlay element (e.g., via cosmetic filter). > 5. A second overlay appears instead, with no real video loaded. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/8iqc2bg77ew4wksc48w0w8sock00k00kme7zf7fw68.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.102 MV2 System version: | `Windows 10` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:

comment.body:
@AdamWr @kodiakhub Found a relevant discussion from uAssets' internal discussion and it seems
```
facebook.com#%#(()=>{const e={apply:(e,t,a)=>{if(a[2]?.[0]&&a[2][0].includes?.("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))try{const e=a[2][0],t=e.split(/\r?\n|\r/).map((e=>JSON.parse(e)));t.forEach((e=>{e.data?.viewer?.marketplace_feed_stories?.edges&&(e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges=e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges.filter((e=>!e.node?.__typename?.includes("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))))}));const r=t.map((e=>JSON.stringify(e))).join("\r\n");a[2][0]=r}catch(r){return console.trace(r),Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}return Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}};window.Function.prototype.call=new Proxy(window.Function.prototype.call,e)})();
```
works.

Quote of gorhill:
> Progress: it turns out that if I join the resulting JSON lines with `\r\n` instead of just `\n`, there is no more breakage, even with the different encoding for Unicode characters or `%` or even `/`.
